books.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter

chapters.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:1
verses.text: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter  Matthew xxvii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:2
verses.text: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing, but that rather a tumult was made, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just person:  see ye to it.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:3
verses.text: Then answered all the people, and said, His blood be on us, and on our children.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:4
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:5
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:6
verses.text: Then released he Barabbas unto them:  and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered him to be crucified.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:7
verses.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto him the whole band of soldiers.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:8
verses.text: And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:9
verses.text: And when they had platted a crown of thorns, they put it upon his head, and a reed in his right hand:  and they bowed the knee before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!    And they spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:10
verses.text: Mark xv.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:11
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:12
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:13
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:14
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:15
verses.text: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:16
verses.text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:17
verses.text: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head,    And began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!    And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:18
verses.text: Luke xxiii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:19
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:20
verses.text: Lk.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:21
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:22
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:23
verses.text: Lk.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:24
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:25
verses.text: ; Acts iv.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:26
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:27
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:28
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:29
verses.text: Lk.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:30
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:31
verses.text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:32
verses.text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:33
verses.text: John xix.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:34
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:35
verses.text: John passim.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:36
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:37
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:38
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:39
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:40
verses.text: Then delivered he him therefore unto them to be crucified.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:41
verses.text: And they took Jesus, and led him away.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:42
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:43
verses.text: But of the Jews none washed his hands, neither Herod nor any one of his judges.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:44
verses.text: And when they had refused to wash them, Pilate rose up.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:45
verses.text: And Herod the king commandeth that the Lord be taken, saying to them, What things soever I commanded you to do unto them, do.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:46
verses.text: And there was come there Joseph the friend of Pilate and of the Lord; and, knowing that they were about to crucify him, he came to Pilate and asked the body of the Lord for burial.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:47
verses.text: And Pilate sent to Herod and asked his body.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:48
verses.text: And Herod said, Brother Pilate, even if no one had asked for him, we purposed to bury him, especially as the sabbath draweth on:  for it is written in the law, that the sun set not upon one that hath been put to death.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:49
verses.text: And he delivered him to the people on the day before the unleavened bread, their feast.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:50
verses.text: And they took the Lord and pushed him as they ran, and said, Let us drag away the Son of God, having obtained power over him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:51
verses.text: And they clothed him with purple, and set him on the seat of judgement, saying, Judge righteously, O King of Israel.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:52
verses.text: And one of them brought a crown of thorns and put it on the head of the Lord.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:53
verses.text: And others stood and spat in his eyes, and others smote his cheeks:  others pricked him with a reed; and some scourged him, saying, With this honour let us honour the Son of God.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:54
verses.text: Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:55
verses.text: And after that they had mocked him, they took the robe off from him, and put his own raiment on him, and led him away to crucify him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:56
verses.text: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name:  him they compelled to bear his cross.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:57
verses.text: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,  Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:58
verses.text: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:59
verses.text: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:60
verses.text: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:61
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:62
verses.text: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:63
verses.text: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:64
verses.text: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:65
verses.text: For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:66
verses.text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:67
verses.text: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?    And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:68
verses.text: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:69
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:70
verses.text: And he bearing his cross went forth into a place called the place of a skull, which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha:  Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:71
verses.text: Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:72
verses.text: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall:  and when he had tasted thereof, he would not drink.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:73
verses.text: And they crucified him, and parted his garments, casting lots:  that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:74
verses.text: And sitting down they watched him there;    And set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:75
verses.text: Then were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:76
verses.text: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,  Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:77
verses.text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh:  but he received it not.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:78
verses.text: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:79
verses.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:80
verses.text: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:81
verses.text: And with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:82
verses.text: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:83
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:84
verses.text: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:85
verses.text: And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:86
verses.text: And the people stood beholding.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:87
verses.text: And the rulers also with them derided him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:88
verses.text: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,    And saying, If thou be the King of the Jews, save thyself.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:89
verses.text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:90
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:91
verses.text: Where they crucified him, and two other with him, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:92
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:93
verses.text: vv.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:94
Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:95
verses.text: And Pilate wrote a title, and put it on the cross.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:96
verses.text: And the writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:97
verses.text: This title then read many of the Jews:  for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city:  and it was written in Hebrew, and Greek, and Latin.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:98
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:99
verses.text: And they brought two malefactors, and they crucified the Lord between them.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:100
verses.text: But he held his peace, as though having no pain.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:101
verses.text: And when they had raised the cross, they wrote upon it, This is the King of Israel.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:102
verses.text: And having set his garments before him, they parted them among them, and cast lots for them.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:103
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:104
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:105
verses.text: Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:106
verses.text: And saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days, save thyself.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:107
verses.text: If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:108
verses.text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him, with the scribes and elders, said,    He saved others; himself he cannot save.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:109
verses.text: If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:110
verses.text: He trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him:  for he said, I am the Son of God.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:111
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:112
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:113
verses.text: The thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:114
verses.text: Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:115
verses.text: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,    Save thyself, and come down from the cross.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:116
verses.text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:117
verses.text: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:118
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:119
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:120
verses.text: And they that were crucified with him reviled him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:121
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:122
verses.text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:123
verses.text: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?  John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:124
verses.text: Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but that he said, I am King of the Jews.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:125
verses.text: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:126
verses.text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also his coat:  now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:127
verses.text: They said therefore among themselves, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be:  that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my raiment among them, and for my vesture they did cast lots.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:128
verses.text: These things therefore the soldiers did.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:129
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:130
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:131
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:132
verses.text: And one of those malefactors reproached him, saying, We for the evils that we have done have suffered thus, but this man, who hath become the Saviour of men, what wrong hath he done to you?    Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:133
verses.text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:134
verses.text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is to say, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?  Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:135
verses.text: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:136
verses.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?  Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:137
verses.text: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds:  but this man hath done nothing amiss.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:138
verses.text: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:139
verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:140
verses.text: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:141
verses.text: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:142
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:143
verses.text: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:144
verses.text: When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son!    Then saith he to the disciple, Behold thy mother!  And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own home.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:145
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:146
verses.text: And they, being angered at him, commanded that his legs should not be broken, that he might die in torment.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:147
verses.text: And it was noon, and darkness came over all Judaea:  and they were troubled and distressed, lest the sun had set, whilst he was yet alive:  for it is written for them, that the sun set not on him that hath been put to death.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:148
verses.text: Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:149
verses.text: Some of them that stood there, when they heard that, said, This man calleth for Elias.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:150
verses.text: And straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:151
verses.text: The rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:152
verses.text: Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:153
verses.text: And, behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom;  and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;    And the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,    And came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:154
verses.text: Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:155
verses.text: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:156
verses.text: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:157
verses.text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:158
verses.text: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:159
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:160
verses.text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit:  and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:161
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:162
verses.text: After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, saith, I thirst.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:163
verses.text: Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar:  and they filled a spunge with vinegar, and put it upon hyssop, and put it to his mouth.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:164
verses.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished:  and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:165
verses.text: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:166
verses.text: Then came the soldiers, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:167
verses.text: But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:  Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:168
verses.text: And one of them said, Give him to drink gall with vinegar.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:169
verses.text: And they mixed and gave him to drink,   and fulfilled all things, and accomplished their sins against their own head.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:170
verses.text: And many went about with lamps, supposing that it was night, and fell down.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:171
verses.text: And the Lord cried out, saying, My power, my power, thou hast forsaken me.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:172
verses.text: And when he had said it he was taken up.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:173
verses.text: And in that hour the vail of the temple of Jerusalem was rent in twain.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:174
verses.text: Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:175
verses.text: Now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:176
verses.text: And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:    Among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's children.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:177
verses.text: When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathaea, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus' disciple:  Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:178
verses.text: And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:179
verses.text: There were also women looking on afar off:  among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;    (Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:180
verses.text: And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,    Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:181
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:182
verses.text: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:183
verses.text: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:184
verses.text: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:185
verses.text: And, behold, there was a man named Joseph, a counsellor; and he was a good man, and a just:    (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) he was of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews:  who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:186
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:187
verses.text: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:188
verses.text: And he that saw it bare record, and his record is true:  and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:189
verses.text: For these things were done, that the scripture should be fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:190
verses.text: And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:191
verses.text: And after this Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus:  and Pilate gave him leave.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:192
verses.text: He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:193
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:194
verses.text: And then they drew out the nails from the hands of the Lord, and laid him upon the earth, and the whole earth quaked, and great fear arose.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:195
verses.text: Then the sun shone, and it was found the ninth hour:    and the Jews rejoiced, and    Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:196
verses.text: He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:197
verses.text: Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:198
verses.text: And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,    And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock:  and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:199
verses.text: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:200
verses.text: Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:201
verses.text: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead:  and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:202
verses.text: And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:203
verses.text: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:204
verses.text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:205
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:206
verses.text: This man went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:207
verses.text: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:208
verses.text: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:209
verses.text: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:210
verses.text: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:211
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:212
verses.text: And there came also Nicodemus, which at the first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred pound weight.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:213
verses.text: Then took they the body of Jesus, and wound it in linen clothes with the spices, as the manner of the Jews is to bury.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:214
verses.text: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:215
verses.text: There laid they Jesus therefore because of the Jews' preparation day; for the sepulchre was nigh at hand.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:216
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:217
verses.text: gave his body to Joseph that he might bury it,  since he had seen what good things he had done.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:218
verses.text: And he took the Lord, and washed him, and wrapped him in a linen cloth, and brought him into his own tomb,  which was called the Garden of Joseph.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:219
verses.text: Then the Jews and the elders and the priests, perceiving what evil they had done to themselves, began to lament and to say, Woe for our sins:  the judgement hath drawn nigh, and the end of Jerusalem.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:220
verses.text: And I with my companions was grieved; and being wounded in mind we hid ourselves:  for we were being sought for by them as malefactors, and as wishing to set fire to the temple.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:221
verses.text: Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:222
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:223
verses.text: Mt.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:224
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:225
verses.text: Now the next day, that followed the day of the preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees  came together unto Pilate,    Saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I will rise again.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:226
verses.text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead:  so the last error shall be worse than the first.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:227
verses.text: Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch:  go your way, make it as sure as ye can.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:228
verses.text: So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting a watch.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:229
verses.text: Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:230
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:231
verses.text: Mk.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:232
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:233
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:234
verses.text: Mk.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:235
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:236
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:237
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:238
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:239
verses.text: And upon all these things we fasted and sat mourning and weeping night and day until the sabbath.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:240
verses.text: But the scribes and Pharisees and elders being gathered together one with another, when they heard that all the people murmured and beat their breasts, saying, If by his death these most mighty signs have come to pass, see how just he is,—  the elders were afraid and  came to Pilate, beseeching him and saying,   Give us soldiers, that we may guard his sepulchre for three days, lest his disciples come and steal him away, and the people suppose that he is risen from the dead and do us evil.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:241
verses.text: And Pilate gave them Petronius the centurion with soldiers to guard the tomb.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:242
verses.text: And with them came the elders and scribes to the sepulchre,    And having rolled a great stone together with the centurion and the soldiers, they all together who were there set it at the door of the sepulchre;    And they affixed seven seals, and they pitched a tent there and guarded it.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:243
verses.text: And early in the morning as the sabbath was drawing on, there came a multitude from Jerusalem and the region round about, that they might see the sepulchre that was sealed.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:244
verses.text: And in the night in which the Lord's day was drawing on, as the soldiers kept guard two by two in a watch, there was a great voice in the heaven;  and they saw the heavens opened, and two men descend from thence with great light and approach the tomb.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:245
verses.text: And that stone which was put at the door rolled of itself and made way in part; and the tomb was opened, and both the young men entered in.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:246
verses.text: When therefore those soldiers saw it, they awakened the centurion and the elders,—for they too were hard by keeping guard;   and, as they declared what things they had seen, again they see three men coming forth from the tomb, and two of them supporting one, and a cross following them.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:247
verses.text: And of the two the head reached unto the heaven, but the head of him that was led by them overpassed the heavens.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:248
verses.text: And they heard a voice from the heavens, saying, Hast thou preached to them that sleep?    And a response was heard from the cross, Yea.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:249
verses.text: They therefore considered one with another whether to go away and shew these things to Pilate.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:250
verses.text: And while they yet thought thereon, the heavens again are seen to open, and a certain man to descend and enter into the sepulchre.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:251
verses.text: When the centurion and they that were with him saw these things, they hastened in the night to Pilate, leaving the tomb which they were watching, and declared all things which they had seen, being greatly distressed and saying, Truly he was the Son of God.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:252
verses.text: Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:253
verses.text: cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:254
verses.text: Mt.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:255
verses.text: xxvii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:256
verses.text: Chapter XXVIII.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:257
verses.text: In the end of the sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:258
verses.text: And, behold, there was a great earthquake:  for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:259
verses.text: His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:  Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:260
verses.text: Chapter XVI.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:261
verses.text: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:262
verses.text: And very early in the morning the first day of the week, they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:263
verses.text: And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?    And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away:  for it was very great.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:264
verses.text: And entering into the sepulchre,  they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were affrighted.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:265
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:266
verses.text: Chapter XXIV.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:267
verses.text: Now upon the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain others with them.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:268
verses.text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:269
verses.text: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:270
verses.text: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:    And as they were afraid, and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?  John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:271
verses.text: Chapter XX.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:272
verses.text: The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre,  and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:273
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:274
verses.text: Pilate answered and said, I am pure from the blood of the Son of God:  but ye determined this.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:275
verses.text: Then they all drew near and besought him and entreated him to command the centurion and the soldiers to say nothing of the things which they had seen:    For it is better, say they, for us to incur the greatest sin before God, and not to fall into the hands of the people of the Jews and to be stoned.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:276
verses.text: Pilate therefore commanded the centurion and the soldiers to say nothing.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:277
verses.text: And at dawn upon the Lord's day, Mary Magdalen, a disciple of the Lord, fearing because of the Jews, since they were burning with wrath, had not done at the Lord's sepulchre the things which the women are wont to do for those that die and for those that are beloved by them—    she took her friends with her and came to the sepulchre where he was laid.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:278
verses.text: And they feared lest the Jews should see them, and they said, Although on the day on which he was crucified we could not weep and lament, yet now let us do these things at his sepulchre.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:279
verses.text: But who shall roll away for us the stone that was laid at the door of the sepulchre, that we may enter in and sit by him and do the things that are due?    For the stone was great, and we fear lest some one see us.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:280
verses.text: And if we cannot, yet if we but set at the door the things which we bring for a memorial of him, we will weep and lament, until we come unto our home.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:281
verses.text: And they went away and found the tomb opened,  and coming near they looked in there;  and they see there a certain young man sitting in the midst of the tomb, beautiful and clothed in a robe exceeding bright;    Matthew.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:282
verses.text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake, and became as dead men.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:283
verses.text: And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye:  for I know that ye seek Jesus, which was crucified.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:284
verses.text: He is not here:  for he is risen, as he said.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:285
verses.text: Come, see the place where the Lord lay.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:286
verses.text: And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him:  lo, I have told you.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:287
verses.text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:288
verses.text: Mark.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:289
verses.text: And he saith unto them, Be not affrighted:  ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified:  he is risen; he is not here:  behold the place where they laid him.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:290
verses.text: But go your way, tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee:  there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:291
verses.text: And they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulchre; for they trembled and were amazed:  neither said they any thing to any man; for they were afraid.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:292
verses.text: Levi, etc.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:293
verses.text: ; cf.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:294
verses.text: Mk.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:295
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:296
verses.text: Luke.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:297
verses.text: He is not here, but is risen:  remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,    Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:298
verses.text: And they remembered his words,    And returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:299
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:300
verses.text: Peter.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:301
verses.text: who said unto them,   Wherefore are ye come?  Whom seek ye?  Him that was crucified?  He is risen and gone.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:302
verses.text: But if ye believe not, look in and see the place where he lay, that he is not here; for he is risen and gone away thither, whence he was sent.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:303
verses.text: Then the women feared and fled.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:304
verses.text: Now it was the last day of the unleavened bread, and many were going forth, returning to their homes, as the feast was ended.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:305
verses.text: But we, the twelve disciples of the Lord, mourned and were grieved:  and each one, being grieved for that which was come to pass, departed to his home.

verses.name: Synoptical Table  of the  Four Canonical Gospels  and  The Gospel According to Peter 1:306
verses.text: But I, Simon Peter and Andrew my brother, took our nets and went to the sea; and there was with us Levi the son of Alphaeus, whom the Lord….
